Artifact module

class autoop.core.ml.artifact.Artifact(name, asset_path, data, type, version='1_0_0', metadata={}, tags=[])[source]

Bases: object

Represents an artifact with metadata, data, and associated properties like name, version, and tags

property asset_path: str

Gets the asset path of the artifact

property data: bytes

Gets the data associated with the artifact

property id: str

Gets the ID of the artifact

property metadata: Dict[str, str]

Gets the metadata dictionary of the artifact

property name: str

Gets the name of the artifact

read()[source]

Decodes the stored data :returns: The stored data as bytes :rtype: pd.DataFrame

save(new_data)[source]

Replaces the stored data with new data :type new_data: bytes :param new_data: New data to save :type new_data: bytes

Returns:

The updated data

Return type:

bytes

property tags: List[str]

Gets the tags associated with the artifact

property type: str

Gets the type of the artifact

property version: str

Gets the version of the artifact

class autoop.core.ml.dataset.Dataset(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Artifact

Represents a dataset artifact containing a pandas DataFrame

static from_dataframe(data, name, asset_path, version='1_0_0')[source]

Create a Dataset from a pandas DataFrame :type data: DataFrame :param data: DataFrame to store in the Dataset :type data: pd.DataFrame :type name: str :param name: Name of the dataset :type name: str :type asset_path: str :param asset_path: Path for the dataset asset :type asset_path: str :type version: str :param version: Version identifier for the dataset, :type version: str, optional :param defaults to “1_0_0”:

Returns:

A new Dataset containing the DataFrame data.

Return type:

Dataset

read()[source]

Decode and returns the dataset data as a pandas DataFrame :returns: DataFrame containing the decoded dataset :rtype: pd.DataFrame

save(data)[source]

Save a pandas DataFrame to the dataset :type data: DataFrame :param data: DataFrame to save in the dataset :type data: pd.DataFrame

Returns:

The encoded CSV data as bytes

Return type:

bytes

autoop.core.ml.metric.get_metric(name)[source]

Factory function to retrieve a metric by its name :type name: str :param name: The name of the metric to retrieve :type name: str

Return type:

Union[MeanAbsoluteError, MeanSquaredError, RootMeanSquaredError, MeanAbsolutePercentageError, RSquared, Accuracy, MicroAveragePrecision, MacroAveragePrecision, MicroAverageRecall, MacroAverageRecall]

Returns:

Union[MeanAbsoluteError, MeanSquaredError, RootMeanSquaredError,

RSquared, Accuracy, MacroAveragePrecision, MacroAverageRecall]: The corresponding metric object

Raises:

ValueError – If the provided metric name is not in the accepted list
